snippet: The discovery by the plant’s operator came a day after an admission that radioactive particles had been found in water flowing into the stricken plant.
abstract: Tokyo Electric Power Company, operator of stricken Fukushima nuclear plant, says it has found a leak in one of hundreds of steel tanks used to store radioactive water at the plant, raising renewed questions about company’s ability to handle plant’s cleanup.
lead_paragraph: The discovery by the plant’s operator came a day after an admission that radioactive particles had been found in water flowing into the stricken plant.

headline.seo: Leak Found in Tank at Fukushima Nuclear Plant
headline.main: Leak Found in Steel Tank for Water at Fukushima
headline.print_headline: Leak Found In Steel Tank For Water At Fukushima
